BTW I have not seen this before, is this new?

```

kafka.metrics.MetricsTest > testBrokerTopicMetricsUnregisteredAfterDeletingTopic FAILED
    java.lang.AssertionError: Topic metrics exists after deleteTopic
        at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
        at org.junit.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:41)
        at org.junit.Assert.assertFalse(Assert.java:64)
        at kafka.metrics.MetricsTest.testBrokerTopicMetricsUnregisteredAfterDeletingTopic(MetricsTest.scala:89)
```

Thanks for the review @guozhangwang. That failure is explained and fixed here https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/3042
@KyleWinkelman can you rebase this? @guozhangwang can you please review and merge?
@guozhangwang can you please review and merge
@jaikiran I merged the trunk PR and cherry-picked e2d4198c4ca9 to 0.10.2 (it merged cleanly). Can you please rebase this PR against 0.10.2 and add the changes we added to the trunk PR during review?
Thanks for the review @guozhangwang, rebased against trunk and fixed a trivial conflict. @hachikuji, let me know if you'd like to review this as well or if I should go ahead and merge it.
Added a tiny commit that removes unnecessary casts in `TransactionLog` (use `getLong` and similar instead of `get`+`asInstanceOf`).
@ijuma, done. PR has been updated. Given the nature of changes, please review once more, before merging.

The failure is unrelated:

```text
java.lang.AssertionError: expected:<List(first, second, third)> but was:<List()>
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.junit.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:834)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:118)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:144)
	at kafka.integration.UncleanLeaderElectionTest.verifyUncleanLeaderElectionDisabled(UncleanLeaderElectionTest.scala:259)
	at kafka.integration.UncleanLeaderElectionTest.testUncleanLeaderElectionDisabled(UncleanLeaderElectionTest.scala:125)
```

Merging to trunk.

Thanks @KyleWinkelman for the find! I made another pass over other store impls just to make sure that `store serdes` are used not the raw `keySerde` or `agg/valueSerde`, and it seems KAFKA-5205/5206 are the only issues. But if there are other similar issues please let @dguy and myself know.
